Items.name: Attack Order
Items.effects: Attack Order is a Critical Hit on 18+.

Items.name: Bug Bite

Items.name: Bug Buzz
Items.range: Cone 2 or Close Blast 2; Sonic, Smite
Items.effects: Bug Buzz lowers the Special Defense of all legal targets by -1 CS on 19+.

Items.name: Defend Order
Items.effects: Raise the user's Defense and Special Defense by +1 CS each.

Items.name: Fell Stinger
Items.effects: If the user successfully knocks out the target with Fell Stinger, raise the user's Attack by +2 CS.

Items.name: Fury Cutter
Items.effects: If Fury Cutter is used successfully and consecutively on the same target, the Damage Base is increased by +4; the first hit has a DB of 4; the second hit a DB of 8, the third hit a DB of 12, and the fourth and all further hits have a DB of 16. If Fury Cutter misses or fails to damage its target, its Damage Base resets.

Items.name: Heal Order
Items.effects: The user regains HP equal to half of its full HP.

Items.name: Infestation
Items.effects: The target is put in a Vortex.

Items.effects: After the target takes damage, the user gains HP equal to half of the damage they dealt to the target.

Items.effects: The target is Pushed 1 meter.

Items.name: Powder
Items.effects: The target is dusted with a Coat of flammable powder. If the affected target uses a damaging Fire-Type attack, the attack is negated and instead creates a Blast 3 centered on itself as the powder explodes, and the Coat is removed. All legal targets within the Blast take damage equal to what the user of the Fire-Type attack would roll for the damage of their attack. This damage is Typeless or Fire-Type, whichever would be more effective.

Items.name: Quiver Dance
Items.effects: Raise the user's Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by +1 CS each.

Items.name: Silver Wind

Items.effects: Spider Web cannot miss. The target is Stuck and Trapped. If the target is freed of the Stuck condition, it is freed of Trapped as well. *Grants Threaded

Items.name: Steamroller
Items.effects: Steamroller Flinches the target on 15+. If the target is Small, Steamroller deals an additional +5 Damage.

Items.name: Sticky Web
Items.effects: Set 8 square meters of Sticky Web hazards within your range such that all 8 meters are adjacent with at least one other space of Sticky Web. Sticky Web causes Terrain to become Slow Terrain, and a grounded foe that runs into the hazard has its Speed lowered by -1 CS and becomes Slowed until the end of their next turn. Flying-type Pokémon and Pokémon and Trainers with Levitate are not affected by Sticky Web. Bug-type Pokémon may move over Sticky Web harmlessly, destroying theHazards as they do so. *Grants Threaded

Items.name: String Shot
Items.effects: Lower the Speed of all legal targets by -1 CS. If this lowers their Speed CS to -6, or if their Speed CS was already at -6, they are instead Stuck. *Grants Threaded

Items.name: Struggle Bug
Items.effects: Lower the Special Attack of all legal targets by -1 CS.

Items.name: Tail Glow
Items.effects: Raise the user’s Special Attack by +3 CS. *Grants Glow

Items.effects: Twineedle Poisons the target on 18+.

Items.effects: The user deals damage and then is immediately recalled to its Poké Ball in the same turn. A New Pokémon may immediately be sent out. Using U-Turn lets a Trapped user be recalled.

Items.effects: If Assurance’s target has already been damaged by a Move on the same round Assurance is being used, Assurance has a Damage Base of 12 (3d12+10 / 30) instead. This effect may trigger only once per Scene per Target.

Items.effects: The user and up to two allies adjacent to the target may each make a Struggle Attack against the target. These Struggle Attacks hit for Dark-Type Damage instead of their usual Type. Beat Up may trigger Pack Hunt only once, no matter the number of attacks.

Items.name: Bite
Items.effects: Bite Flinches the target on 15+.

Items.name: Dark Pulse

Items.name: Fake Tears
Items.effects: Lower the target's Special Defense by -2 CS.

Items.effects: Feint Attack Cannot Miss.

Items.effects: Set-Up Effect: Make Sky Drop's Accuracy Check. If the user hits, the user and target are moved 25 meters into the air. Items.name: Pain Split
Items.effects: The user and the target both lose 1/2 of their current Hit Points. Add the amount of Hit Points the user and the target lost together, and divide the value by 2. Both the target and the user gain Hit Points equal to this value. Do not add Injuries from Pain Split from Hit Point Markers until the full effect of the Move has been resolved. Pain Split never causes Massive Damage. Hit Point loss from Pain Split cannot be prevented in any way.

Items.name: Pay Day
Items.effects: Pay Day scatters metal coins equal in value to 1d8 times the user's level. If it is a trainer battle, the winner of the battle gets to pick up the coins.

Items.name: Perish Song
Items.effects: Perish Song cannot miss. All targets, including the user, receive a Perish Count of 3. At the beginning of each of the target’s turns, their Perish count is lowered by 1. Once a Perish Count reaches 0, set the Pokémon’s Hit Points to 0. A Perish Count disappears if a target returns to their Poké Ball, Takes a Breather, or is knocked out. Perish Song never causes Massive Damage.

Items.name: Play Nice
Items.effects: Play Nice lowers the target’s Attack by -1 CS.

Items.name: Present
Items.effects: Roll 1d6; Present has a DB equal to twice the result. On a result of 1, instead of taking damage the target gains 20 HP.

Items.name: Protect
Items.effects: If the user is hit by a Move, the user may use Protect. The user is instead not hit by the Move. The user does not take any damage nor is affected by any of the Move's effects.

Items.name: Psych Up
Items.effects: The user's Combat Stages are changed to match the target's Combat Stages. Psych Up cannot miss.

Items.name: Rage
Items.effects: The user becomes Enraged. Until the end of the user’s next turn, if the user is Enraged, the user gains +1 Attack Combat Stage whenever they are damaged by an Damaging Move or Attack.

Items.name: Rapid Spin
Items.effects: Rapid Spin destroys all Hazards within 5 meters, removes Leech Seeds, and removes the user's Trapped or Stuck status.

Items.name: Razor Wind
Items.effects: Set-Up Effect: The user may not shift this round. The user whips up a whirlwind around themselves, granting +2 Evasion until the end of their next turn and destroying any Smokescreen or Hazards on any squares it is standing on and in all squares adjacent to it. Resolution Effect: The user attacks with Razor Wind. Razor Wind is a Critical Hit on 18+.

Items.name: Recover
Items.effects: The user regains HP equal to half of its full HP.

Items.name: Recycle
Items.effects: The effect of a consumable item used earlier in the encounter is used again as if it had not been destroyed. The item is still gone.

Items.name: Reflect Type
Items.effects: Reflect Type changes one of the user’s Types into one Type of your choice that the target has for the rest of the scene.

Items.name: Refresh
Items.effects: The user is cured of all Poison, Burns, and Paralysis.

Items.name: Relic Song
Items.effects: All legal targets fall Asleep on 16+. As long as Meloetta knows Relic Song, it may change between Aria Form and Step Form as a Swift Action when using Relic Song or as a Standard Action otherwise. Both Aria and Step Form must be statted with the same HP Stat.

Items.name: Retaliate
Items.effects: Retaliate's DB is doubled to DB 14 (4d10+15 / 40) if an ally has been Fainted by a Damaging Move used by the Target in the last 2 rounds of Combat.

Items.name: Return
Items.effects: Return's DB is equal to 3 plus the user's Loyalty Value.

Items.name: Roar
Items.effects: When declaring Roar, the user does nothing. At the end of the round, the user Shifts and uses Roar. Targets hit by Roar immediately Shift away from the user using their highest useable movement capability, towards their Trainer if possible. If the target is an owned Pokémon and ends this shift within 6 meters of their Poké Ball, they are immediately recalled to their Poké Ball. If that Trainer sends out a replacement, they do not lose their Command action.

Items.name: Rock Climb
Items.effects: Rock Climb Confuses the target on 17+.

Items.name: Round
Items.effects: Round's Damage Base is equal to 6, plus +2 more for each use of Round by any Trainer or Pokémon this round, up to a maximum of DB 12 (3d12+10 / 30).

Items.name: Safeguard
Items.effects: Blessing – Any user affected by Safeguard may activate it when receiving a Status Affliction to ignore the effects of that Status Affliction on their next turn. Safeguard may be activated 3 times, and then disappears.

Items.name: Scary Face
Items.effects: Lower the target’s Speed by -2 CS.

Items.name: Screech
Items.effects: Lower the Defense of all legal targets by -2 CS.

Items.name: Secret Power
Items.effects: Secret Power's effect depends on Environ. Secret Power's effect activates on 17+.

Items.name: Self-Destruct
Items.effects: The user's HP is set to -50% of its full HP. This HP loss may not be prevented or reduced in any way. The user's loyalty may be lowered.

Items.name: Sharpen
Items.effects: Raise the user’s Attack by +1 CS.

Items.name: Shell Smash
Items.effects: Raise the user's Attack, Special Attack, and Speed by +2 CS each. Lower the user's Defense and Special Defense by -1 CS each.

Items.name: Simple Beam
Items.effects: You choose one of the target's Abilities. Simple Beam changes that Ability to Simple for the remainder of the encounter.

Items.name: Sing
Items.effects: All legal Targets fall Asleep. On a miss, Sing instead causes targets to become Slowed and suffer a -2 penalty to their Evasion until the end of the user's next turn.

Items.name: Sketch
Items.effects: Sketch cannot miss. Once Sketch has been used, remove Sketch from the user's Move list. The last Move that the target used is added to the user's Move list permanently. Sketch may not be Interrupted or Intercepted.

Items.name: Skull Bash
Items.effects: Set-Up Effect: Raise the user's Defense by +1 CS. Resolution Effect: The user may attack with Skull Bash. The target is pushed 3 meters.

Items.name: Slack Off
Items.effects: The user regains HP equal to half of its full HP.

Items.name: Slam
Items.effects: Slam may be used as a Free Action at the end of a Sprint Maneuver taken as a Standard Action, as long as the user Shifted at least 3 meters in a straight line towards the target. When used this way, Slam gains the Smite keyword.

Items.name: Slash
Items.effects: Slash is a Critical Hit on 18+.

Items.name: Sleep Talk
Items.effects: Select another of the user’s Moves at random; this turn, the user may Shift and use that Move despite being Asleep. Sleep Talk can be only be used by Sleeping targets.

Items.name: Smelling Salts
Items.effects: If the target is Paralyzed, Smelling Salt’s Damage Base is doubled to 14 (4d10+15 / 40), and cures the target of Paralysis.

Items.name: Smokescreen
Items.effects: Smokescreen creates a blast of Smoke that covers the target area; the Smoke persists until the end of the encounter, or until Defog or Whirlwind are used. All targets attacking from or into the Smoke receive a -3 penalty to Accuracy.

Items.name: Snore
Items.effects: Snore Flinches all legal targets on 15+. Snore may be used by Sleeping users.

Items.name: Soft-Boiled
Items.effects: The target regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Points. The user may target themselves with Soft-Boiled.

Items.name: Sonic Boom
Items.effects: Sonicboom causes the target to lose 15 HP. Sonicboom is Special and interacts with other moves and effects as such (Special Evasion may be applied to avoid it, Mirror Coat can reflect it, etc.)

Items.name: Spit Up
Items.effects: For each Stockpiled Count the user has, Spit Up’s Damage Base is increased by +8. If the user has no Stockpiled count, Spit Up cannot be used.

Items.name: Splash
Items.effects: Shift Action - The user may make a single Jump, adding +1 to their Long Jump and High Jump values, and gains +2 Evasion until the end of their next turn. *Grants +1 Long Jump

Items.name: Stockpile
Items.effects: The user adds 1 to their Stockpiled count to a maximum of 3. For each number a Stockpiled count is above 0, raise the user’s Defense and Special Defense by +1 CS each. If a Stockpiled count is set to 0, any Combat Stages gained from the Stockpiled count are removed.

Items.name: Stomp
Items.effects: Stomp Flinches the target on 15+. If the target is at least one size category smaller than the user, Stomp deals an additional 10 damage.

Items.name: Strength
Items.effects: You may immediately initiate a Push Maneuver as a Free Action. The Maneuver automatically hits, but you must still make the Opposed Roll. *Grants +1 Power

Items.name: Substitute
Items.effects: The user loses 1/4 of their maximum Hit Points. This Hit Point loss cannot be prevented in any way. The user creates an Illusory Substitute Coat, which has Hit Points equal to 1/4th of the user’s full Hit Points +1. If the user would be hit by a Move or attack, instead the Substitute gets hit. Apply weakness, resistance and stats to the Substitute. The Substitute is immune to Status Afflictions and Status Moves. Moves with the Social or Sonic keywords completely ignore and bypass the Substitute. Once the Substitute has been destroyed, the user may be hit as normal. Substitute cannot be used if the user has less than 1/4 of their full Hit Points.

Items.name: Super Fang
Items.effects: The target loses 1/2 of its current HP.

Items.name: Supersonic
Items.effects: The target becomes Confused. On miss, the target suffers a -2 penalty to Accuracy Rolls for one full round.

Items.name: Swagger
Items.effects: Raise the target's Attack by +2 CS. The target is Confused.

Items.name: Swallow
Items.effects: If the user’s Stockpiled count is 1, they are healed 25% of their full Hit Point value; if their Stockpiled count is 2, they are healed half of their full Hit Point value; if their Stockpiled count is 3, they are healed back to full Hit Points. After using Swallow, the user’s Stockpiled count is set to 0. If the user has no Stockpiled count, Swallow does nothing.

Items.name: Sweet Scent
Items.effects: Targets hit by Sweet Scent gain a -2 Penalty to Evasion. (Total Evasion may not be lowered to a negative value.) *Grants Alluring

Items.name: Swift
Items.effects: Swift cannot Miss.

Items.name: Swords Dance
Items.effects: Raise the user's Attack by +2 CS.

Items.name: Tackle
Items.effects: The target is Pushed 2 Meters.

Items.name: Tail Whip
Items.effects: All legal targets have their Defense lowered by -1 CS.

Items.name: Take Down
Items.effects: You may perform a Trip Maneuver against the target as a Free Action.

Items.name: Techno Blast
Items.effects: Techno Blast’s Type can be any Type while holding the appropriate Drive item or Plate item.

Items.name: Teeter Dance
Items.effects: All legal targets are Confused.

Items.name: Thrash
Items.effects: After damage is dealt, the user becomes Enraged and Confused.

Items.name: Tickle
Items.effects: Lower the target’s Attack and Defense by -1 CS each.

Items.name: Transform
Items.effects: The user targets a Pokémon within 10 meters and assumes the form of the target. It gains all of the target's Moves, Abilities, and Capabilities; and copies its weight and height. Transform lasts until the user is switched out, Fainted, or until the end of the encounter. The user may choose to end the Transformation on its turn as a free action, regaining its previous Move List. The user's Stats do not change from using Transform. Transform cannot miss.

Items.name: Tri Attack
Items.effects: Tri Attack gives the target a Status ailment on 17+. If this effect is triggered, roll 1d3; on 1 the target is Paralyzed; on 2 the target is Burned; on 3 the target is Frozen.

Items.name: Trump Card
Items.effects: Whenever the user uses Trump Card, the user gains a Trump Count after the attack is resolved. Trump Card's DB is increased by +2 for each Trump Count.

Items.name: Uproar
Items.effects: All Pokémon and Trainers within 5 meters of the user are cured of Sleep.

Items.name: Weather Ball
Items.effects: If it is Sunny, Weather Ball is Fire-Type. If it is Rainy, Weather Ball is Water-Type. If it is Hailing, Weather Ball is Ice-Type. If it is Sandstorming, Weather Ball is Rock-Type. When a weather effect is on the field, Weather Ball has a Damage Base of 10 (3d8+10 / 24). If there are multiple Weather Effects on the field, choose one type for Weather Ball to be that corresponds with an existing Weather Effect.

Items.name: Whirlwind
Items.effects: All targets are pushed X meters, where X is 8 minus their weight class. If the Line targets into a Smokescreen, the smoke is dispersed. All hazards in the Whirlwind are destroyed.

Items.name: Wish
Items.effects: At the end of the user's next turn, the target regains HP equal to half of its full HP. If the user targets itself and is replaced in battle, the replacement is healed by half of its own HP.

Items.name: Work Up
Items.effects: Raise the user’s Attack and Special Attack by +1 CS each.

Items.name: Wrap
Items.effects: The user gains a +1 Bonus to Accuracy Rolls made to initiate Grapple Maneuvers, and +2 to Skill Checks made to initiate Grapple Maneuvers or gain Dominance. Whenever the user gains Dominance in a Grapple, the target of the Grapple loses a Tick of Hit Points.

Items.name: Wring Out
Items.effects: For every 10% the target is below their full HP, Wring Out's Damage Base is reduced by -1.

Items.name: Yawn
Items.effects: The target falls Asleep at the end of its next turn. Yawn cannot miss.

Items.name: Acid
Items.effects: Acid lowers the target’s Defense by -1 Combat Stage on 18+.

Items.name: Acid Armor
Items.effects: Set-Up Effect: The user becomes Liquefied. While Liquefied, the user is Slowed and cannot take Standard Actions except to Resolve the effect of Acid Armor, the user's Movement is never obstructed by rough or slow terrain, and the user can shift even through the smallest openings. Furthermore, while Liquefied, the user is completely immune to all Physical damage and becomes completely invisible if fully submerged in any liquid. Resolution Effect: The user gains +1 Defense CS, then stops being liquified.

Items.name: Acid Spray
Items.effects: Acid Spray lowers the target’s Special Defense by -2 CS.

Items.name: Belch
Items.effects: Belch cannot be used if the user has not traded in a Digestion/Food Buff during this Scene.

Items.name: Clear Smog
Items.effects: The target's Combat Stages are reset to their defaults, and all Coats on the target are destroyed. Clear Smog cannot miss.

Items.name: Coil
Items.effects: Raise the user’s Attack and Defense by +1 CS, and the user gains +1 Accuracy.

Items.name: Cross Poison
Items.effects: Cross Poison is a Critical Hit on 18+ and Poisons the target on 19+.

Items.name: Gastro Acid
Items.effects: The target's Ability is disabled until the end of the encounter. If the target has more than one ability, you choose one of them to disable.

Items.name: Gunk Shot
Items.effects: Gunk Shot Poisons the target on 15+.

Items.name: Poison Fang
Items.effects: Poison Fang Badly Poisons the target on 17+.

Items.name: Poison Gas
Items.effects: Poison Gas Poisons all legal targets.

Items.name: Poison Jab
Items.effects: Poison Jab Poisons the target on 15+.

Items.name: Poison Powder
Items.effects: The target is Poisoned.

Items.name: Poison Sting
Items.effects: Poison Sting Poisons the target on 17+.

Items.name: Poison Tail
Items.effects: Poison Tail is a Critical Hit on 18+ and Poisons the target on 19+.

Items.name: Sludge
Items.effects: Sludge Poisons the target on 15+.

Items.name: Sludge Bomb
Items.effects: Sludge Bomb Poisons the target on 15+.

Items.name: Sludge Wave
Items.effects: Sludge Wave Poisons all legal targets on 19+.

Items.name: Smog
Items.effects: Smog Poisons all legal targets on an Even-Numbered Roll.

Items.name: Toxic
Items.effects: The target is Badly Poisoned. If the user is Poison Type, Toxic cannot miss.

Items.name: Toxic Spikes
Items.effects: Set 8 square meters of Toxic Spikes within the range such that all 8 meters are adjacent with at least one other space of Toxic Spikes. Toxic Spikes cause Terrain to become Slow Terrain, and a grounded foe that runs into the hazard becomes Poisoned and Slowed until the end of their next turn. If there are 2 layers of Toxic Spikes on the same space, it Badly Poisons the foes instead. Poison-Type Pokémon may move over Toxic Spikes harmlessly, destroying the Hazards as they do so.

Items.name: Venom Drench
Items.effects: All Poisoned targets have their Attack, Special Attack, and Speed lowered by -1 CS. Venom Drench cannot miss.

Items.name: Venoshock
Items.effects: If the target is Poisoned, Venoshock has a Damage Base of 13 (4d10+10 / 35) instead.

Items.name: Agility
Items.effects: Raise the user’s Speed 2 Combat Stages.

Items.name: Ally Switch
Items.effects: Ally Switch may be declared during a foe’s turn as an Interrupt. The user chooses one willing ally within 6 meters; the target and the user switch places. If the ally was a target of a Move, the user is now the target; If the user was a target of a Move, the ally is now the target.

Items.name: Amnesia
Items.effects: Raise the user’s Special Defense 2 Combat Stages.

Items.name: Barrier
Items.effects: The user creates a Barrier of psychic energy. The user places up to 4 segments of Barrier; each segment must be continuous with another segment, and at least one must be adjacent to the user. These barriers count as blocking terrain and last until the end of the encounter or until they are destroyed. Each Barrier segment is 2 meters tall, 1 meter wide, and 2 centimeters thick. Each segment has 20 Hit Points, 15 Damage Reduction, and takes damage as if it was Psychic Typed.

Items.name: Calm Mind
Items.effects: Raise the user’s Special Attack 1 Combat Stage and raise the user’s Special Defense 1 Combat Stage.

Items.name: Confusion
Items.effects: Confusion Confuses the target on 19+.

Items.name: Cosmic Power
Items.effects: Raise the user’s Defense 1 Combat Stage and raise the user’s Special Defense 1 Combat Stage.

Items.name: Dream Eater
Items.effects: Dream Eater can only target Sleeping Pokémon or Trainers. After the target takes damage, the user gains Hit Points equal to half of the damage they dealt to the target. Dream Eater does not wake up sleeping targets.

Items.name: Extrasensory
Items.effects: Extrasensory Flinches the target on 19+.

Items.name: Future Sight
Items.effects: Future Sight does nothing on the turn it is used. At the end of the user's next turn, Future Sight hits, even if the user is no longer on the field. Future Sight cannot miss.

Items.name: Gravity
Items.effects: For 5 rounds, the area is considered Warped. While Warped, Moves that involve the user being airborne may not be used. Pokémon cannot use Sky or Levitate Capabilities to end their turn at an altitude higher than 1 meter. Flying-Types and Pokémon with the Ability Levitate are no longer immune to Ground-Type Moves. All Accuracy Rolls receive a +2 Bonus.

Items.name: Guard Split
Items.effects: The target loses 5 Defense and 5 Special Defense. If they do, the user gains 5 Damage Reduction. These effects last until the end of the Scene.

Items.name: Guard Swap
Items.effects: The user and the target trade Combat Stage values for the Defense Stat, and then for the Special Defense Stat.

Items.name: Heal Block
Items.effects: Until the end of the encounter, the target may not gain HP or Temporary HP from any source. This effect ends if the target is switched out or Takes a Breather.

Items.name: Healing Wish
Items.effects: The user immediately Faints, lowering its HP to 0. The user takes no Injuries from HP Markers when using Healing Wish. The target is immediately cured of up to 3 injuries, healed to their Maximum Hit Points, and has the Frequency of all Moves restored. Healing Wish may target a Pokémon in a Poké Ball. Healing Wish does not restore the Frequency of Healing Wish or Lunar Dance. Injuries healed through Healing Wish count toward the total number of Injuries that can be healed each day, and this healing is limited by the same.

Items.name: Heal Pulse
Items.effects: Restores 50% of the target’s max Hit Points. Heal Pulse’s user may not target itself with Heal Pulse.

Items.name: Heart Stamp
Items.effects: Heart Stamp Flinches the target on 15+.

Items.name: Heart Swap
Items.effects: The targets trade Combat Stage values for each stat.

Items.name: Hypnosis
Items.effects: The target falls Asleep.

Items.name: Imprison
Items.effects: The target is Locked for the rest of the Scene. A Locked target may not use any Moves the user knows. Imprison cannot miss.

Items.name: Kinesis
Items.effects: If the user or an Ally within 6 meters is about to be hit by an attack, the user may use Kinesis as an interrupt. The triggering Accuracy Roll receives a -4 penalty. This may cause Moves to miss.

Items.name: Light Screen
Items.effects: Blessing – Any user affected by Light Screen may activate it when receiving Special Damage to resist the Damage one step. Light Screen may be activated 2 times, and then disappears.

Items.name: Lunar Dance
Items.effects: The user immediately Faints, lowering its Hit Points to 0. The user takes no Injuries from Hit Point Markers when using Lunar Dance. The target is immediately cured of up to 3 injuries, healed to their Maximum Hit Points, and has the Frequency of all Moves restored. Lunar Dance may target a Pokémon in a Poké Ball. Lunar Dance does not restore the Frequency of Healing Wish or Lunar Dance. Injuries healed through Lunar Dance count toward the total number of Injuries that can be healed each day, and this healing is limited by the same.

Items.name: Luster Purge
Items.effects: Luster Purge lowers the target's Special Defense by -1 CS on an Even-Numbered Roll.

Items.name: Magic Coat
Items.effects: If the user is about to get a hit by a Move that does not have a Damage Dice Roll, they may use Magic Coat as an Interrupt. The Interrupted Move’s user is treated as if they were the target of their own Move, with the user of Magic Coat as the user.

Items.name: Magic Room
Items.effects: The area becomes Useless for 5 rounds. While Useless, Pokémon may not benefit from the effects of any Held Items, and Trainers cannot benefit from any Accessory-Slot equipment. This does not affect consumable or activated items, only Items with Static effects or Triggers.

Items.name: Meditate
Items.effects: Raise the user’s Attack 1 Combat Stage.

Items.name: Miracle Eye
Items.effects: Miracle Eye may be activated as a Swift Action on the user’s turn. For the rest of the turn, the user’s Psychic-Type Moves can hit and affect Dark-Type targets, and the user can see through the Illusion Ability, Moves with the Illusion keyword, and effects created by the Illusionist Capability, ignoring all effects from those.

Items.name: Mirror Coat
Items.effects: Mirror Coat may be used as a Reaction when the user is hit by a damaging Special Attack. Resolve the Triggering Attack, with Mirror Coat’s user resisting the attack one step further. After the attack is resolved, if Mirror Coat’s user was not Fainted, the triggering foe then loses Hit Points equal to twice the amount of Hit Points lost by the user from the triggering attack. Note that Mirror Coat is Special, and while it cannot miss, it cannot hit targets immune to Psychic-Type Moves.

Items.name: Mist Ball
Items.effects: Mist Ball lowers the target’s Special Attack by 1 Combat Stage on an Even-Numbered Roll.

Items.name: Power Split
Items.effects: The target has their Attack and Special Attack lowered by 5. If they do, the user gains a +5 bonus to Damage Rolls. These effects last until the end of the scene.

Items.name: Power Swap
Items.effects: The user and the target trade Combat Stage values for the Attack Stat, and then for the Special Attack Stat.

Items.name: Power Trick
Items.effects: The user's Attack stat and Defense stat are switched for the remainder of the encounter, or until the user is switched out or Fainted.

Items.name: Psybeam
Items.effects: Psybeam Confuses the target on 19+.

Items.name: Psychic
Items.effects: The target is Pushed 1 meter in any direction. Psychic lowers the target’s Special Defense 1 Combat Stage on 17+.  Grants Telekinetic.

Items.name: Psycho Boost
Items.effects: Lower the user's Special Attack by -2 Combat Stages after damage is resolved.

Items.name: Psycho Cut
Items.effects: Psycho Cut is a Critical Hit on 18+.

Items.name: Psycho Shift
Items.effects: The user is cured of a Status ailment and the target is given that Status ailment. Psycho Shift cannot miss. Psycho Shift can only be used if the user has a Status ailment and the target does not have the status ailment that is being transferred.

Items.name: Psyshock
Items.effects: When calculating damage, the target subtracts their Defense from Psyshock's damage instead of their Special Defense. Psyshock is still otherwise Special (Special Evasion is used to avoid it, Mirror Coat can reflect it, etc.)

Items.name: Psystrike
Items.effects: When calculating damage, the target subtracts their Defense from Psystrike's damage instead of their Special Defense. Psystrike is still otherwise Special (Special Evasion is used to avoid it, Mirror Coat can reflect it, etc.)

Items.name: Psywave
Items.effects: Roll 1d4; on 1 the target loses HP equal to half the user's Level; on 2 the target loses HP equal to the user's Level; on 3 the target loses HP equal to 1.5x the user's level; on 4 the target loses HP equal to the user's Level doubled. Do not apply weakness or resistance, and do not apply Stats. Do apply Immunity.

Items.name: Reflect
Items.effects: Blessing – Any user affected by Reflect may activate it when receiving Physical Damage to resist the Damage one step. Reflect may be activated 2 times, and then disappears.

Items.name: Rest
Items.effects: The user is set to their full Hit Point value. The user is cured of any Status ailments. Then, the user falls Asleep. The user cannot make Sleep Checks at the beginning of their turn. They are cured of the Sleep at the end of their turn in 2 rounds.

Items.name: Role Play
Items.effects: The user gains one of the target's Abilities, chosen at random, for the remainder of the encounter. This effect ends if the user Faints or is switched out. Role Play cannot miss.

Items.name: Skill Swap
Items.effects: The user loses one of their Abilities, selected by the user, and gains one the target’s Abilities, selected at random, for the remainder of encounter. The target loses the copied Ability, and gains the user’s lost Ability. This effect ends if either the target or the user is Switched out or Fainted, but only for that Pokémon or Trainer.

Items.name: Stored Power
Items.effects: For every Combat Stage the user has above 0, add +2 to Stored Power’s Damage Base, up to a maximum of Damage Base 20.

Items.name: Synchronoise
Items.effects: Synchronoise can only hit targets that share a type with Synchronoise's user.

Items.name: Telekinesis
Items.effects: The target becomes Lifted. While Lifted, they gain the Levitate Ability, are Slowed, and lose all Movement Capabilities except for the Levitate 4 granted by Levitate (reduced to 2 by the Slow condition). While Lifted, the user may not apply any Evasion bonuses to determine whether they are hit by Moves or not. The Lifted target may use a Shift Action to roll 1d20; on a result of 16+, they stop being Lifted. *Grants Telekinetic

Items.name: Teleport
Items.effects: The user Teleports up to X meters, where X is its Teleporter Capability. Any Move that targeted Teleport's user continue through the desired target's space if the Move allows for it as if the user hadn't been there; single target moves simply miss. *Grants Teleporter 4

Items.name: Trick
Items.effects: Both targets must be hit for Trick to succeed. The user may target itself or willing allies with Trick; you do not need to roll for Accuracy Check in these cases. Both targets lose their Held Item and gain the other target's Held Item. If a target has no Held Item, they still can gain the other target's Held Item.

Items.name: Trick Room
Items.effects: Starting at the beginning of the next round, for 5 rounds, the area is considered Rewinding. While Rewinding, Initiative is reversed, and participants instead go from lowest Initiative to highest.

Items.name: Wonder Room
Items.effects: For 5 rounds, the area is considered Wondered. While Wondered, each individual Pokémon's Defense and Special Defense are switched.

Items.name: Zen Headbutt
Items.effects: Zen Headbutt Flinches the target on 15+.

Items.name: Ancient Power
Items.effects: The user has each of its stats raised by +1 CS on 19+.

Items.name: Diamond Storm
Items.effects: Diamond Storm raises the User’s Defense by +1 CS on an Even-Numbered Roll.

Items.name: Head Smash
Items.effects: The target is pushed 2 meters.

Items.name: Rock Blast
Items.effects: *Grants Materializer

Items.name: Rock Polish
Items.effects: Raise the user's Speed by +2 CS.

Items.name: Rock Slide
Items.effects: Rock Slide Flinches all legal targets on 17+.

Items.name: Rock Tomb
Items.effects: Rock Tomb lowers the target's Speed by -1 CS. *Grants Materializer

Items.name: Rock Wrecker
Items.effects: *Grants Materializer

Items.name: Rollout
Items.effects: The user continues to use Rollout on each of its turns until they miss any target with Rollout, or are not able to hit any target with Rollout during their turn. Each successive use of Rollout increases Rollout’s Damage Base by +4 to a maximum of DB 15.

Items.name: Sandstorm
Items.effects: The weather changes to a Sandstorm for 5 rounds. While it is Sandstorming, all non-Ground, Rock, or Steel Type Pokémon lose a Tick of Hit Points at the beginning of their turn.

Items.name: Smack Down
Items.effects: The target is knocked down to ground level, and loses all Sky or Levitate Speeds for 3 turns. During this time, they may be hit by Ground-Type Moves even if normally immune.

Items.name: Stealth Rock
